result.execSummary:
The defendant Grant E. Rinden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentences Mr. Rinden to 8 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 5 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith

superMiscConds.notes: --To pay statutory costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA surcharge

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random drug/alcohol screening
 (at least 1x/month for the 1st 6 months upon release from custody)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and approved by Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Marla Hartley or any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Arresting Agency: Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grant E. Rinden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on 1/19/16 before Judge Koschnick

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:21 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Grant E. Rinden in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews criminal case settlement form with Mr. Rinden; ADA Hall requests recess, due to request of DA regarding withdrawl of offer
Recess: 11:25 am Reconvene: 11:47 am
ADA Hall informs the Court that she was able to communicate with DA Happ and she has reinstated offer, so are ready to proceed

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences Mr. Rinden to 8 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 5 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To pay statutory costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA surcharge 
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random drug/alcohol screening (at least 1x/month for the 1st 6 months upon release from custody)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and approved by Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Marla Hartley or any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Court does not authorize expungement
Recess: 12:09 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Grant E. Rinden
Current: 1010 Caswell St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 500 Monroe Street, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538
Sent to Defendant (1) NOH for 1/19/16 Plea/Sentencing Hearing//sent to LKA

Case called at 2:35 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Grant E. Rinden in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Requests matter be set for change of plea/sentencing in early January for about 45 minutes
ADA Teuber: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Rinden that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 2:36 pm

NEXT: Schedule Plea/Sentencing 1/19/16 at 11:00 am - Send notices

Case called at 11:23 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Grant E. Rinden in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Still working on agreement, requests additional STC in 30 - 45 days, will be able to give court better idea on where case is heading
ADA Beck: No objection
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Beck indicates that the State is not aware of any bond issues
Court reminds Mr. Rinden that his bonds/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 11:24 am 

NEXT:  (1) Schedule STC 11/20/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices

Case called at 8:36 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Grant E. Rinden in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Rinden waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:44 am 

NEXT: (1) Case to remain as scheduled

Court's response to letter treatment program: The Court will consider this request only after both parties have been given the opportunity to respond. Adjournment of scheduled court dates will be granted only upon formal motion and hearing or stipulation. cc: all
from DA Happ advising that the State is demanding a speedy preliminary hearing
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 8/26/15

[MK] case called at 1:33pm. 
Defendant Grant E. Rinden appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).   Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Rinden verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are current. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Maria Hartley or with Joseph Coleman
--no presence at 311 Park Street in Fort Atkinson
--no possession of syringes without a documented medical need
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
recess 1:38pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/16/15 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference on 10/16/15 at 11:00am-JA please note in comments that case is at Prelim stage
